path_1.title: Kedi (2016)
path_1.feeling: Crass animated cat caper sounds amusing in spots but not quite my style.

path_1.title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983)
path_1.feeling: Fun space adventure, though the sequel vibe tempers my enthusiasm.

path_1.title: The Revenant (2015)
path_1.feeling: Brutal survival revenge with immersive craft is squarely in my wheelhouse.

path_1.title: Isle of Dogs (2018)
path_1.feeling: Meticulous animation and offbeat heart hit the right notes for me.

path_1.title: Hugo (2011)
path_1.feeling: Charming and lovingly crafted, if a touch too sentimental for my taste.

path_1.title: Airplane! (1980)
path_1.feeling: The relentless gag machine mostly lands and scratches my comedy itch.

path_1.title: Dirty Pretty Things (2002)
path_1.feeling: Tense, humane crime drama is exactly the kind of thriller I gravitate toward.

path_1.title: Why We Fight (2005)
path_1.feeling: Sharp, probing docu-essay that aligns with my appetite for substantive nonfiction.

path_1.title: To Kill a Mockingbird (1962)
path_1.feeling: Classic, clear-eyed drama that still packs moral weight.

path_1.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
path_1.feeling: Whimsical worldbuilding is fine, but franchise fuss keeps me at arm’s length.

path_1.title: Shining, The (1980)
path_1.feeling: Unnerving precision and atmosphere I can’t resist.

path_1.title: District 9 (2009)
path_1.feeling: Smart, gritty sci‑fi with teeth is my kind of ride.

path_1.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes (2014)
path_1.feeling: Serious, muscular sequel with stakes and atmosphere I appreciate.

path_1.title: True Grit (2010)
path_1.feeling: Lean, well-acted western that hits the craftsmanship sweet spot.

path_1.title: Exorcist, The (1973)
path_1.feeling: Classic dread and conviction that burrows under my skin.

path_1.title: Inside Man (2006)
path_1.feeling: Clever, confident heist thriller that stays a step ahead.

path_1.title: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens (2015)
path_1.feeling: Polished and fun, if a bit too nostalgic to fully wow me.

path_1.title: Godfather: Part II, The (1974)
path_1.feeling: Epic, cold-blooded crime saga that satisfies my taste for heavyweight drama.

path_1.title: When Harry Met Sally... (1989)
path_1.feeling: Witty enough to win me over despite my rom‑com skepticism.

path_1.title: Strangers on a Train (1951)
path_1.feeling: Elegant, winding Hitchcock tension that I reliably enjoy.

path_1.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_1.feeling: Moody and intriguing, though its adolescent haze keeps me slightly removed.

path_1.title: Invention of Lying, The (2009)
path_1.feeling: High concept, uneven execution that doesn’t click with my comedy tastes.

path_1.title: Argo (2012)
path_1.feeling: Taut, crowd-pleasing rescue thriller with satisfying craft.

path_1.title: Eagle vs Shark (2007)
path_1.feeling: Quirky-awkward romance that lands more twee than true for me.

path_1.title: Looper (2012)
path_1.feeling: Grimy, clever time-crime blend that fits my sci‑fi preferences.

path_1.title: Ronin (1998)
path_1.feeling: Crisp, unfussy action-thriller with heist vibes I enjoy.

path_1.title: Persepolis (2007)
path_1.feeling: Personal, political animation that plays to both my head and heart.

path_1.title: The Martian (2015)
path_1.feeling: Problem‑solving, science-forward survival story that’s squarely my thing.

path_1.title: Curse of the Golden Flower (Man cheng jin dai huang jin jia) (2006)
path_1.feeling: Lavish and operatic, but the stylized palace intrigue keeps me at a distance.

path_5.feeling: Rousing, pulpy space fantasy with enough stakes and set-pieces to satisfy me.

path_5.title: The Revenant (2015)
path_5.feeling: Immersive, brutal survival odyssey whose atmosphere and physicality grip me.

path_5.title: Isle of Dogs (2018)
path_5.feeling: Meticulous stop-motion, droll humor, and a sharp allegory—right up my alley.

path_5.title: Hugo (2011)
path_5.feeling: Cinephile-hearted adventure with warmth, craft, and a nostalgic glow I enjoy.

path_5.title: Airplane! (1980)
path_5.feeling: Relentless gag machine—some groaners, plenty of laughs, overall a fun ride.

path_5.title: Dirty Pretty Things (2002)
path_5.feeling: Tense, humane thriller with social bite that hooks me.

path_5.title: Why We Fight (2005)
path_5.feeling: Clear, incisive polemic that provokes and informs without bluster.

path_5.title: To Kill a Mockingbird (1962)
path_5.feeling: Stirring moral drama that still lands with clarity and heart.

path_5.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
path_5.feeling: Whimsical world-building charms, but franchise beats feel a bit thin.

path_5.title: Shining, The (1980)
path_5.feeling: Icy dread and precision craft—an all-timer that still chills me.

path_5.title: District 9 (2009)
path_5.feeling: Sharp, gritty allegory with gnarly sci-fi textures that energize me.

path_5.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes (2014)
path_5.feeling: Serious-minded spectacle with moral weight and brooding atmosphere I appreciate.

path_5.title: True Grit (2010)
path_5.feeling: Lean, character-driven western that satisfies on grit and wit.

path_5.title: Exorcist, The (1973)
path_5.feeling: Blunt, unnerving classic whose austerity and terror still hit hard.

path_5.title: Inside Man (2006)
path_5.feeling: Sleek, clever heist puzzle with great momentum and personality.

path_5.title: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens (2015)
path_5.feeling: Polished, nostalgic adventure that entertains even as it plays safe.

path_5.title: Godfather: Part II, The (1974)
path_5.feeling: Expansive, icy crime epic—rich character work and moral rot that engross me.

path_5.title: When Harry Met Sally... (1989)
path_5.feeling: Witty, warmly observed rom-com that works for me despite the genre.

path_5.title: Strangers on a Train (1951)
path_5.feeling: Elegant, propulsive Hitchcock thriller with a killer premise.

path_5.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_5.feeling: Moody, off-kilter teen psychodrama whose vibe I like more than its logic.

path_5.title: Invention of Lying, The (2009)
path_5.feeling: Clever concept, but the broad, sentimental execution gives me pause.

path_5.title: Argo (2012)
path_5.feeling: Tight, engaging political caper that balances tension and crowd-pleasing craft.

path_5.title: Eagle vs Shark (2007)
path_5.feeling: Awkward, deadpan charm in spots, but the twee tone wears thin for me.

path_5.title: Looper (2012)
path_5.feeling: Snappy, noir-tinged time-loop thriller I enjoy even if it doesn’t fully cohere.

path_5.title: Ronin (1998)
path_5.feeling: Muscular, no-nonsense thriller with crackling chases and cool professionalism.

path_5.title: Persepolis (2007)
path_5.feeling: Spare, poignant animation that hits with honesty and insight.

path_5.title: The Martian (2015)
path_5.feeling: Cheerfully pragmatic survival science that’s brisk, clever, and likable.

path_5.title: Curse of the Golden Flower (Man cheng jin dai huang jin jia) (2006)
path_5.feeling: Sumptuous palace intrigue whose melodrama overwhelms my engagement.

path_5.title: Kedi (2016)
path_5.feeling: Raunchy alley-cat antics sound amusing in spots, but the crassness likely wears thin for me.

path_5.title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983)
path_5.feeling: Classic space-adventure sweep that still satisfies me.

path_5.title: The Revenant (2015)
path_5.feeling: Ferocious survival epic I admire for craft more than I love for story.

path_5.title: Isle of Dogs (2018)
path_5.feeling: Tactile craft and deadpan wit make this offbeat adventure a pleasure.

path_5.feeling: Gorgeous movie-love valentine whose sentimentality keeps me a step removed.

path_5.title: Airplane! (1980)
path_5.feeling: Gag-a-second silliness where the hit rate is high enough to keep me grinning.

path_5.feeling: A gripping, humane social thriller that sticks with me.

path_5.feeling: Humane, quietly devastating classic that still packs moral weight.
